summary: The Tools Tax Deduction Act (H.R. 2173) amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow deductions for certain work-related expenses for employees. It creates an above-the-line deduction for expenses like construction tools and protective gear, and modifies miscellaneous itemized deductions to include expenses related to an employee's trade or business. These changes apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
